a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Urban improved water access vs. rural water access, 2020
Data source: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP) for Water Supply and Sanitation
Note: An improved drinking water source includes piped water on premises (piped household water connection located inside the
users dwelling, plot or yard), and other improved drinking water sources (public taps or standpipes, tube wells or boreholes, protected
dug wells, protected springs, and rainwater collection).
